text: Masada Iosefa (26 January 1988 – 25 January 2021) was a Samoan professional rugby league player. He played as a hooker. He played for the Penrith Panthers and Wests Tigers in the National Rugby League (NRL). He also played for the Samoan national team. Iosefa was born in Motoʻotua, Samoa. He moved to Australia at a young age. After his playing career, he was a youth worker in Rockhampton, Queensland. On 25 January 2021, the day before his 33rd birthday, Iosefa died in a quad bike accident in Herbert, a rural locality of Darwin, Northern Territory. ==References== ==Other websites== *Masada Iosefa at Rugby League Project Category:1988 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Accidental deaths in Australia Category:Road accident deaths Category:Rugby league players
title: Masada Iosefa
